sense.name: LAP OVER: lie partly over or alongside of something or of one another.
sense.examples: The cheese lapped over the side of the sandwich. The omelette lapped over the side of the plate. The sides of the crepe tend to lap over.

sense.name: Pass the tongue over, possibly with the intent of ingesting.
sense.examples: The dog lapped her hand. The cat lapped up the milk. John's kitten lapped at the saucer of milk.

sense.name: (Cause to) flow against, possible making a sound.
sense.examples: The bubbles lapped against the glass. The waves lap gently on the shore.

sense.name: Pass by a full circuit, as in a race.
sense.examples: He lapped his opponents several times. She lapped her fellow swimmers.
